summary: A cable from the CIA Headquarters to Hong Kong station requesting assistance in contacting a former employee regarding the public release of documents under the JFK Assassination Records Collection Act of 1992, advising the former employee of their name's appearance in the documents and offering guidance on how to request postponement of public disclosure if warranted.
summary_one_paragraph: This secret cable, dated March 6, 1997, from the CIA Headquarters to its Hong Kong station, instructs the station to contact a former employee residing in Hong Kong who retired under cover. The purpose of the contact is to inform the individual that their name appears in documents being reviewed for public release under the JFK Assassination Records Collection Act of 1992 and to provide them with information and assistance in requesting a postponement of the disclosure of their name if its release poses a threat to them, their family, or sensitive activities. The cable also relays frequently asked questions and answers about the process and potential implications of the release.
title: Request for Station Assistance
